thread.title: ComScore to Buy Rentrak for Over $800 Million in All-Stock Deal - Bloomberg Business
thread.title_full: ComScore to Buy Rentrak for Over $800 Million in All-Stock Deal - Bloomberg Business

author: yahoo
title: ComScore to Buy Rentrak for Over $800 Million in All-Stock Deal - Bloomberg Business
text:
Share on Facebook Share on Twitter Share on WhatsApp Share on LinkedIn Share on Reddit Share on Google+ E-mail Share on Twitter Share on WhatsApp ComScore Inc., the Internet researcher, agreed to buy Rentrak Corp. in an all-stock merger valued at more than $800 million, combining two media-monitoring companies to create a more formidable rival to Nielsen.
Investors will receive 1.15 shares of ComScore for each Rentrak share they own, according to a statement Tuesday from the companies. ComScore gained in extended trading after the announcement, rising as high as $45, suggesting the deal could be worth as much as $51.75 a share to Rentrak stockholders.
The merger represents a new challenge to Nielsen Holdings Plc, which produces the TV audience ratings that underpin advertising rates and does a range of research for media and consumer products companies. The deal combines two big players in media measurement -- ComScore tracks Web activity while Rentrak reports on TV viewing, DVD sales and the movie box-office, as well as some online activity.
